intro: Ficus luducca, commonly known as the Bornean fig, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered figs that are typically green when immature and turn yellow or red when ripe. Ficus luducca thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Its roots can become invasive, making it a challenging plant to manage in certain environments.
